pages.text: In order to craft spells, you'll need two things: a spell book and a lectern. If you place your spell book into the lectern, and then open it, you'll notice a different UI appear.$(br2)It'll look a little something like the image on the right. On either side are boxes containing various glyphs, depending on how high your wizard level is.
To the left are all your Spell Shapes, and to your right are all your Spell Effects.

pages.title: Spell Shapes
pages.text: Spell shapes are the mode by which the effects of a spell reach their target. For instance, a Projectile Shape will fire a projectile that, when it collides with an entity or block, will activate the spell effects associated with it.$(br2)Spell Shapes determine the weight, cooldown, and mana multiplier of a spell, and are all you really need for a valid spell - as long as you didn't want it to do anything.

pages.title: Spell Effects
pages.text: Spell Effects, on the other hand, are the actual functional parts of a spell. If you want to set a target on fire, you would use a Fire Effect!$(br2)Spell Effects must come after a Spell Shape in order to apply, and will only be applied to the Spell Shape immediately before them. Spell Effects determine the mana cost of a spell, and are additive. So two Spell Effects that cost 2 mana will result in a spell that costs 4.

pages.title: Chaining
pages.text: To create a spell, you'll need to put a Spell Shape in your book first, followed by whatever Spell Effects you want that shape to apply to the target.$(br2)You can then add another Spell Shape at the end to chain into another aspect of your spell. For instance, a Lob Shape with whatever Spell Effects you want on it, followed by an AOE Shape with its Spell Effects will result in a spell that can create an AOE at range!

Chaining spell shapes and effects is very important to creating powerful spells. You may be inclined to just go all out by stacking a single Spell Effect on a single Spell Shape, but that gets costly and isn't as effective as a spell with chained shapes.$(br2)Just be aware you will need to unlock Spell Shapes and Effects by increasing your wizard level. You also can't cast a spell that costs more than double your mana, so watch those mana costs!
